Class Column<T>

java.lang.Object
com.tablr.model.Column<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BooleanColumn, EmailColumn, IntegerColumn, StringColumn
public abstract sealed class Column<T> extends Object implements Cloneable permits StringColumn, BooleanColumn, EmailColumn, IntegerColumn
Represents a column in a table. Each column has a name, type, default value, and a list of stored values.

  • Constructor Details

    • Column

      protected Column(String name, boolean allowsBlank, T defaultValue, int id)
      Constructs a new column with the specified attributes.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the column.
      allowsBlank - Whether blank values are allowed.
      defaultValue - The default value for new rows.
      id - The unique identifier of the column.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the name is blank or the default value is invalid.

  • Method Details

    • isValidValue

      protected abstract boolean isValidValue(T value)
      Validates the value for the column. This method should be overridden by subclasses to provide specific validation logic.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to be validated.
      Returns:
      True if the value is valid, false otherwise.

    • isValidColumn

      public boolean isValidColumn()
      Checks if the column and its values are valid.
      Returns:
      True if the column and its values are valid, false otherwise.

    • setAllowsBlank

      public boolean setAllowsBlank(boolean newAllowsBlank)
      Tries to update the allowsBlank property. Only succeeds if no values or default are blank.
      Parameters:
      newAllowsBlank - The desired new value for allowsBlank.
      Returns:
      True if updated successfully, false otherwise.

    • toggleDefaultValue

      Throws:

    • setValue

      public void setValue(int index, T value)
      Sets the value at the specified index in the column.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the value to set.
      value - The new value to set.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the value is invalid or blank values are not allowed.
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of bounds.

      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of bounds.

    • canAcceptAllValuesFrom

      public abstract boolean canAcceptAllValuesFrom(Column<?> source)
      Checks whether this column can accept all values and the default value from another column. Used to determine if conversion is possible.
      Parameters:
      source - The column whose values are to be checked for compatibility.
      Returns:
      True if all values and the default value can be accepted, false otherwise.

    • canChangeToType

      public abstract boolean canChangeToType(ColumnType type)
      Checks if the column type can be changed to the specified type.
      Parameters:
      type - The target column type.
      Returns:
      True if the type change is valid, false otherwise.

    • parseValue

      protected abstract T parseValue(String s)
      Parses a string into the correct type for this column. Used internally for conversion validation.
      Parameters:
      s - The string to parse.
      Returns:
      The parsed value.

    • isBooleanColumn

      public boolean isBooleanColumn()
      Checks if the column is a Boolean column.
      Returns:
      True if the column is a Boolean column, false otherwise.

    • changeType

      @Deprecated public abstract Column<?> changeType()
      Deprecated.
      This method is deprecated and may be removed in future versions.
      Changes the type of the column to the next type in the cycle.
      Returns:
      A new column of the next type in the cycle.

    • setValueFromString

      public void setValueFromString(int index, String value)
      Sets the value at the specified index in the column.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the value to set.
      value - The new value to set, not parsed yet.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of bounds.
